alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 10:51AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Carbon and southwestern Albany Counties through 1130 AM MDT... At 1050 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Six Mile Campground, or 43 miles west of Laramie, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albany, Six Mile Campground, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm, Nash Fork Campground, Ryan Park Campground, Rob Roy Reservoir, Lake Owen, Bobbie Thompson Campground, French Creek Campground, Ryan Park, Brooklyn Lake, Sugar Loaf Campground, Libby Creek Campground, Illinois Creek Campground, Miller Lake Campground, Deep Creek Campground, Rob Roy Campground, Centennial and Evans Creek Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 273 and 281, and between mile markers 283 and 284. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
